body_html:
I understand that tf.Session is as any other object. Maybe I did not explain my question clearly.

session_at_step1=tf.session().a_function
tf.session().run(...some feeds....)
session_at_step2=tf.session().a_function

a_function may be "copy()", which means copy everything in the session to make a new session.
or may be "copy( (weight_1, bias_1) )" to only copy the weight_1 and bias_1 and form a new session.

Is there any a function to let session_at_step1 be different with session_at_step2?

body:
I understand that tf.Session is as any other object. Maybe I did not explain my question clearly.

session_at_step1=tf.session().a_function
tf.session().run(...some feeds....)
session_at_step2=tf.session().a_function

a_function may be "copy()", which means copy everything in the session to make a new session.
or may be "copy( (weight_1, bias_1) )" to only copy the weight_1 and bias_1 and form a new session.

Is there any a function to let session_at_step1 be different with session_at_step2?
